intro: Ayenia aristeguietae, commonly known as the Aristeguieta's ayenia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of white hair. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Ayenia aristeguietae is considered a species of conservation concern.
